chargeHist.descr: Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine
Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine

result.execSummary:
The defendant Lonnie R. Noland was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must obtain/maintain employment at the discretion of agent.

Defendant must submit a DNA sample. Defendant shall attend any counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.
Undergo an AODA assessment and participate in treatment as recommended.

timeConds.notes:
Shall commence no later than 9-7-17 by 4:30 p.m.

The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.

Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, and at no additional costs to Taylor County.
Concurrent with: Taylor County Case No. 15CF63

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Court costs paid in full with cash bond.

Huber and good time granted.  

The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.  

Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.
Concurrent with: Taylor County Case No. 16CF82

Court calls case nos. 15CF63, 16CF56, 16CF82, 17CF82, 17CF101, 17CF102. Defendant Lonnie R. Noland in court with attorney Alec Nocco.  Defendant Lonnie R. Noland in custody. Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waiver of preliminary hearing filed on 17CF82, 17CF101 & 17CF102 - based on waiver court bound DE over for trial.  Information filed by the state.  DE waived further reading of same and entered pleas of not guilty to all the charges.  Matters are set for plea and sentencing at a later date.  16CF56 & 16CF82 - Atty Tlusty states joint recommendation.  Atty Nocco makes statement. Court imposed 1 year in Taylor County Jail with Huber and good time concurrent to each other; 123 days sentence credit; court costs reduced to civil a judgment.  Atty Nocco requests a few days of furlough in order for DE to see his grandmother who is ill.  State objects.  Court denies request. ba
for Court Hearing
Sentencing hearing on revocation on January 25, 2018 at 01:30 pm.

records.addlTxt: Court calls case Nos. 15CF63, 16CF56, 16CV27 & 16CF82.  Defendant Lonnie R. Noland in court with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Tlusty placed agreement on the record.  15CF63 - DE entered a plea of no contest to Cts. 1 & amended Ct. 2.  16CF56 - DE entered a plea of no contest to amended Ct. 1. 16CF82 - DE entered a plea of not contest to Ct. 1.  Plea colloquy.  Factual basis exists. Court found plea given freely, voluntarily & intelligently; accepted plea; found DE guilty.  Argument on jail sentence.  15CF63 - Ct. 1 - Pursuant to the agreement the court deferred entry of judgment of conviction for two years and signed agreement.  Ct. 2 - Court withheld sentence and placed DE on probation for 2 years with the following conditions:  6 months county jail with Huber; court costs; DNA sample and surcharge; obtain/maintain employment; letter of apology to victim & victim's parents due within 30 days; counseling as deemed appropriate by agent; restitution to be determined within 30 days.  16CV27 - Court dismissed case.  16CF56 - Court withheld sentence on Ct. 1 and placed DE on probation for 3 years with the following conditions: 6 months county jail with Huber and concurrent to 15CF63; court costs; DNA sample and surcharge; AODA; counseling as deemed appropriate by agent.  Court read in, but dismissed Cts. 2 - 5. 16CF82 - Court withheld sentence on Ct. 1 and placed DE on probation for 3 years with conditions of: 9 months county jail with Huber and concurrent to 15CF63 & 16CF56; court costs; DNA sample and surcharge; AODA; counseling as deemed appropriate by agent.  Court dismissed, but read in Cts. 2 & 3. ba
of Preliminary Hearing

Arrest Report
Initial Appearance on May 10, 2016 at 1:00 p.m.

Attorney Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Lonnie R. Noland appeared in person, in custody.  Court finds probable cause for arrest without warrant based on the arrest header.  Attorney Tlusty requests a $1,000.00 cash bond; booking; no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription; no operation of a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  No statement by defendant.  Court orders bond as requested by Attorney Tlusty.  Court advised defendant of right to an attorney.  Attorney Tlusty requested that the court order the clerk to begin bond revocation proceedings in Case No. 15CF63.  Court so orders.  Next court date is May 10, 2016 at 1:00 pm.  - rt
